intro: Callistephus concolor, commonly known as the common poppy, is a species of flowering plant in the family Papaveraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is characterized by its striking red or pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are showy and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The seeds of Callistephus concolor are encased in a fluffy, wind-dispersed capsule, aiding in its propagation.
